metadata.title: CVE-2021-32491 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in djvulibre-3.5.28 and earlier. An integer overflow infunction render() in tools/ddjvu via crafted djvu file may lead toapplication crash and other consequences.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32491` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

djview - 3.5.27.1-5ubuntu0.1+esm1
djview3 - 3.5.27.1-5ubuntu0.1+esm1
djvulibre-bin - 3.5.27.1-5ubuntu0.1+esm1
djvulibre-desktop - 3.5.27.1-5ubuntu0.1+esm1
djvuserve - 3.5.27.1-5ubuntu0.1+esm1
libdjvulibre-text - 3.5.27.1-5ubuntu0.1+esm1
libdjvulibre21 - 3.5.27.1-5ubuntu0.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: djvulibre package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.27.1-5ubuntu0.1+esm1').
